Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Sheldon Williams, Co-op City Baptist Church, 135 Einstein Loop, Bronx, NY 10475.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Seabrook.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Sheldon Williams, Co-op City Baptist Church, 135 Einstein Loop, Bronx, N.Y. 10475.

Council Member Seabrook moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of October 29 and November 15, 2007 be adopted as printed by Council Member Gennaro.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gennaro moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 29, 2007 and November 15, 2007 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 080023 PQX, an acquisition, shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application no. C 080024 HAX that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 1382-1414 Shakespeare Avenue, Bronx (C080023PQX & C080024HAX)

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sale of tax liens.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the New York State Real Property Tax Law, with respect to properties in the City of New York, to establish a declining property tax exemption on properties constructed or reconstructed where such construction or reconstruction includes the installation of a green roof.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Establish a declining property tax exemption on properties constructed or reconstructed where such construction or reconstruction includes the installation of a green roof.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce and pass legislation that would reduce the threshold amount of child support arrears due and owing before drivers, professional, occupational, business, and recreational licenses of a child support obligee can be suspended from the equivalent of four months of arrears to the equivalent of two months of arrears.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Reduce the threshold amount of child support arrears due and owing before drivers, professional, occupational, business, and recreational licenses of a child support obligee can be suspended from the equivalent of four months of arrear.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to mandating the issuance of fire service elevator express keys to emergency medical service personnel when they begin their tour of duty.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Mandating the issuance of fire service elevator express keys to emergency medical service personnel when they begin their tour of duty.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Governor and the Legislature of the State of New York to enact legislation that would reduce certain factors contributing to wrongful convictions and to establish an independent commission that would conduct a comprehensive study of wrongful convictions in the State.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Reduce certain factors contributing to wrongful convictions and to establish an independent commission that would conduct a comprehensive study of wrongful convictions in the State.

Items.Title: Resolution expressing the Council’s support for the “Uterine Fibroid Research and Education Act of 2007” (H.R. 2349 and S. 1275), which would provide funding for research and education with respect to uterine fibroids.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Support for the “Uterine Fibroid Research and Education Act of 2007” (H.R. 2349 and S. 1275)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass legislation that would guarantee full payment of enlistment bonuses and incentives to veterans wounded in combat.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass legislation that would guarantee full payment of enlistment bonuses and incentives to veterans wounded in combat.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting response times for firefighting units and ambulances to fire and medical emergencies.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Reporting response times for firefighting units and ambulances to fire and medical emergencies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to recycling.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Recycling

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the placement of automated external defibrillators in public libraries.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring the placement of automated external defibrillators in public libraries.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Green Carts

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Equal Employment Practices Commission.

Items.MatterName: Myrtle Avenue Brooklyn BID

Items.Title: Application no. 20085207 HAK, an Urban Development Action Area Project known as Mother Gaston/Bergen, located in Community Board 16, Council District no. 37, Borough of Brooklyn.  This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant to Article 16 of the New York General Municipal Law, at the request of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development, and pursuant to Section 696 of the General Municipal Law for an exemption from real property taxes.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Acting Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again for the Charter Meeting on Wednesday, January 9, 2008.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, First Deputy City Clerk
Acting Clerk of the Council

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

LU No. 0632 & Res No. 1200  44-0-2
LU No. 0634 & Res No. 1201  35-5-6
LU No. 0635 & Res No. 1202  35-5-6
Int No. 613-A  45-0-1
Int No. 651-A  41-5-0
Int No. 656      45-1-0

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Communication from the Brooklyn Borough President - Submitting the name of Shirley A. McRae to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment to the New York City Planning Commission, for the remainder of a term which expires June 30, 2012, pursuant to Sections 31 and 192 (a) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Shirley A. McRae, City Planning Commission
